news.Title: [AI Summary] VisEra Technologies' Stock Price Fluctuates Due to Silicon Photonics, CIS Demand, and Longtan Plant Expansion
news.Content:
According to 20 news reports from the Liberty Times on November 1, 2025, VisEra Technologies (6789.TW) stock price has fluctuated due to multiple factors. First, market rumors indicated that TSMC (2330.TW) leads Intel in the number of silicon photonics patents and is collaborating with VisEra on related technology development, which boosted VisEra's stock price (Liberty Times).

Second, VisEra expects its operations in the second half of the year to benefit from strong demand for CIS (CMOS Image Sensor) and has initiated the construction of the second phase of its Longtan plant, further driving up the stock price, which even hit the daily limit during trading (Liberty Times). Chairman Kwan Hsin also stated that customer demand for mobile phone and automotive CIS is good, driving up capacity utilization, and expects operations in the second half of the year to be better than the first half (Liberty Times).

However, VisEra's operations also face challenges. The micro-optics components business has been impacted by customers' diversification of suppliers, affecting capacity utilization (Liberty Times). In addition, VisEra recorded a monthly loss in October 2024, with a loss of NT$0.06 per share (Liberty Times). The full-year earnings per share in 2024 also significantly declined compared to the previous year, at only NT$1.13, and the company plans to distribute a cash dividend of NT$1 (Liberty Times).

In addition, TSMC's stock price fluctuations also affect VisEra. When TSMC's stock price soars, VisEra's stock price also rises (Liberty Times). Conversely, when TSMC's stock price falls, VisEra's stock price may also be dragged down (Liberty Times).

Finally, after TSMC abandoned the Longtan Park Phase III expansion plan, it was rumored that VisEra and other companies are interested in competing for the land to meet future expansion needs (Liberty Times). Overall, VisEra's stock price performance is influenced by silicon photonics, CIS demand, the Longtan plant expansion plan, and its parent company TSMC, presenting a multi-faceted situation.
